programme.desc: Three wives send their husbands to Dr. Phil's Man Camp for an attitude adjustment.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: A mother defends her son caught in viral attack video.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Shannon, 24, says two years ago, her ex-boyfriend stabbed her multiple times, and she feels betrayed by her mother, Dian, because she didn’t visit her in the hospital. Can they make peace with the past and fix their relationship? Plus, Kasey says she wants her 24-year-old son to stop living at home and playing video games all the time -- but is she part of the problem?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.sub-title: Change My Face, Change My Race
programme.desc: Most everyone has thought about removing imperfections: a nip here, a tuck there. But what about people who want plastic surgery to erase their ethnic identity? Dr. Phil gives his take on divisive racial issues.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: One-time high school sweethearts Tracey and Doug started having marriage problems when Doug admitted to having an affair with a transgender female, Essence.

programme.title: Dr.Phil
programme.desc: Bridget says she is worried that her 38-year-old brother-in-law Kevin may be having an inappropriate relationship with her 16-year-old daughter, Grace. Bridget says red flags went up when Grace told her that Kevin put whipped cream on his neck and asked her to lick it off, and then found a letter from Kevin hidden in Grace’s bedroom. Kevin strongly denies having an inappropriate relationship with Grace, and claims he’s just trying to be a father figure since Grace’s dad passed away. But is there something more?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Bridget says she’s not sure what to believe about the relationship between her 38-year-old brother-in-law, Kevin, and 16-year-old daughter, Grace.Dr. Phil says Bridget is a parent in denial and in need of a wake-up call. He sits down one-on-one with Kevin. How does Kevin explain his actions?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Horrific allegations are tearing a family apart — but who is telling the truth? Todd says he was shocked and appalled when his ex-girlfriend's mother, Diana, accused him of molesting his 4-year-old daughter, Taniya, and turns to Dr. Phil to help clear his name. Diana says that while babysitting Taniya, the toddler detailed ways in which Todd inappropriately touched her, and she's convinced he's done the unthinkable. After learning of the accusations, Taniya's mom, Latia, reported the alleged sexual abuse to a judge who immediately stripped Todd of his parental rights — but was justice served? Latia says that as much as she wants to believe Todd's innocence, as a mother, she needs to take every precaution to protect her child. A year has passed since he's seen his daughter, and Todd says he will go to any length to prove his innocence, including taking another a lie detector test — even though he's already passed one. He's adamant that Diana is lying and says that she coached Taniya to make the accusations. Dr. Phil calls in an expert polygraph examiner. Don't miss the shocking results!

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: A family is on the verge of imploding as their holiday arguments turn violent.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: When couples tie the knot, they vow to stay together "'til death do us part," but what happens when a marriage takes a few bad turns, and one partner desperately wants out?

programme.title: Dr.Phil
programme.desc: How far would you go to protect your child?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: How can you change a racist's thinking? How can someone who has had a racist viewpoint his entire life learn to accept a biracial granddaughter? Catch up on Charlie's story.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Is compulsive spending ruining your life? According to a recent Gallup poll, the average American owes $29,000 in credit card debt, and last year, 1.6 million U.S. households filed for bankruptcy. Dr. Phil has advice for avoiding credit card catastrophes this holiday season.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.sub-title: Is My Sister a Drama Queen or Really Sick?
programme.desc: A woman believes her sister lied about being diagnosed with more than 70 health conditions.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: The conversation continues with a woman who says her sister lied about health diagnoses for attention.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Suzanne says her sister, Jennifer, is a neglectful parent, and she's considering taking action to gain custody of Jennifer’s three children. Suzanne says when the family's home caught fire, Jennifer saved her daughter's friend's baby and left her own children to fend for themselves. Jennifer's 16-year-old daughter, Alyssa, suffered a broken ankle after jumping from the second story, and her 12-year-old son ran back into the burning house to save his 9-year-old sister. Jennifer maintains she is a good mom, and says there was too much smoke and fire to go back for her kids. Was there more she could have done? Is there truth behind Suzanne's accusations? Then, hear Alyssa's emotional plea to Jennifer. Will it make an impact? Don't miss this compelling, all-new Dr. Phil.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: In the last 10 years, the number of women arrested for driving drunk has risen by 30 percent, and police report that more and more young children are sitting in the back seat when these moms are pulled over.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: A self-proclaimed adult bully is confronted.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: The conversation continues with a self-admitted adult bully.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: With the divorce rate reported at more than 50 percent in America, it's inevitable that you or someone you know will end a marriage. How do you know if you're really ready for a divorce? Dr. Phil and civil and family attorney Areva Martin speak with a couple on the verge of ending their union.

programme.title: Dr.Phil
programme.desc: The role of the wife is explored.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Former guests who clashed over what defines a "good wife" return.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: The hot topic of what defines a "good wife" is debated.

programme.title: Dr.Phil
programme.desc: Dr. Phil takes goes inside the unthinkable: making your own child sick to fulfill a disturbing need for attention. The idea might sound unimaginable, but for people with a psychological disorder called Munchausen by Proxy, it's irresistible. Note: Viewer discretion is advised.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Dr. Phil gives family freeloaders a wake-up call.

programme.title: Dr. Phil

programme.desc: Four adult siblings say they have been blacklisted by their mother from seeing their dying father.
